Classification.Etymology: Myoxocephalus: Greek, myos = muscle, and also, mouse + Greek, kephale = head . More on author: Mitchill.

sectionData.Environment: Marine; brackish; demersal; depth range 1 - 190 m . Temperate; 52째N - 36째N, 77째W - 50째W
sectionData.Distribution: Northwest Atlantic: eastern Newfoundland and northern Gulf of St. Lawrence in Canada to Virginia in USA.
sectionData.Biology: Commonly found in harbors and shallow coastal waters. Move to deeper water in winter. Adults attach their eggs near the base of a sponge to use as a spawning bed . Benthic; feeds on crustaceans, molluscs, sea squirts, squids and fishes (herring, mackerel, smelt, sand lance and silversides ) .
sectionData.Life cycle: Adults attach their eggs near the base of a sponge to use as a spawning bed .
